qas.question: What are the main distinctive features of Islamic architecture?

answers.text: ordered repetition, radiating structures, and rhythmic, metric patterns

qas.question: What physical characteristics are common in Islamic architecture?
When did domes first appear in the architecture of the Muslim World?
Which mosque is believed to be the first with a dome?
When was the Taj Mahal constructed?
What first appeared in Muslim architecture in the 6th century?
What mosque was built with a dome in the 6th century?
What structure was built using domes in the 1700's?
Where were Islamic domes used iin the 1900's?

context: Distinguishing motifs of Islamic architecture have always been <a0_0>ordered repetition, radiating structures, and rhythmic, metric patterns<a0_0/>. In this respect, fractal geometry has been a key utility, especially for mosques and palaces. Other features employed as motifs include <a1_0>columns, piers and arches<a1_0/>, organized and interwoven with alternating sequences of niches and colonnettes. The role of <b5_0>domes<b5_0/> in Islamic architecture has been considerable. Its usage spans centuries, first appearing in <a2_0>691<a2_0/> with the construction of the <a3_0>Dome of <b6_0>the Rock mosque<b6_0/><a3_0/>, and recurring even up until the <a4_0>17th century<a4_0/> with <b7_0>the Taj Mahal<b7_0/>. And as late as the 19th century, Islamic domes had been incorporated into <b8_0>European architecture<b8_0/>.
